line_1: The fatal rock was nearly spun,
line_2: And the sad task was nearly done,

line_1: O! let the thread of life be spun
line_2: By one more easily, gently won;
One story more, dear Hill, and I have done:

line_1: In sweet simplicity its hours have spun.
line_2: Guiltless the moments of this plain have run;

line_1: "(Weave we the woof. The thread is spun)
line_2: "(The web is wove. The work is done.)"

line_1: "(Weave we the woof. The thread is spun)
line_2: "(The web is wove. The work is done.)"

line_1: When, to their length, th' appointed Threads are spun,
line_2: Swiftly, O ATROPOS! thy task be done,

line_1: When, as her Line in slower circles spun,
line_2: And her shock'd axis nodded from the sun,
His mighty work who speaks and it is done,

line_1: The sheers suspend, the thread is spun,
line_2: Tis cut — and mortal life is done.

line_1: Thro' all His Thread of Life already spun,
line_2: Becoming Grace and proper Action run:

line_1: And plenteous wicks our rocks and spindles spun.
line_2: The cotton shrub through all the woods had run,

line_1: And then, like a Fool, when her Web was half spun,
line_2: Pull'd to-pieces at Night all the Work she had done:

line_1: Then, when the orator had spun
line_2: His wit, as far as it would run,

line_1: For now our Thread of Happiness was spun;
line_2: The Gains of twenty Years were lost in one.
